description: reconstruction of a wharf structure with construction of a Berlin Wall and shore protection installation
full_summary:
### Wharf Reconstruction Structure 405
#### Solicitation Number: 30003648
#### Request for Proposal
Canada Post: #PW-22-01013659
#### Due Date: November 30th, 2022 @ 13:00:00
---

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is inviting contractors to submit their proposals for the Wharf Reconstruction Structure 405 project. 

**Project Overview**
This project includes the construction of a Berlin Wall and shore protection installation at Structure 405, located at the Petit-Shippagan  public wharf, Gloucester County, N.B. The successful contractor is responsible for furnishing all necessary labor, materials, and equipment to complete the work in accordance with the specifications and drawings provided.

**Key Scope of Work**
Some of the key aspects of the work include:

* Removing existing steel beam guide rail and debris containment curtain
* Removing in-situ fills and material from the harbour bottom
* Temporary support and stabilization of the footing of the existing retaining wall
* Construction of the Berlin Wall structure, including supply and installation of H-Piles, precast concrete wall panels, and cast-in-place cap beams
* Supply and installation of filter fabric, granular base, and armour stone

**Contract Terms and Conditions**
The successful contractor will be responsible for mobilizing and demobilizing all necessary equipment to complete the project, as well as adhering to environmental controls. The project duration is approximately 6 months, with completion deadline of June 15th, 2023.

**Contract Evaluation Criteria**
Proposals will be evaluated on the following:

* Technical proposal
* Quality of mandatory documents
* Practical application of statement of work
* Pricing schedule
* Resume of solo supporting the submission

**Submission Requirements**
Should be in electronic format and include:

* Signed and dated copies of tender responses
* All mandatory documents, if any
* Attachments relevant to the bid

For further details and bidding instructions, please review the [Solicitation Document] (link) and its attachments provided on the Canada13000 Tendering System.

Information for Bidder are:

- Contractor: Fisheries and Oceans Canada 
- Address: 200 Kent St, Station 13E228 Ottawa Ontario K1A 0E6
- Email: contact.dfo-tenders [Tart storage awaited] com
- Phone Number: 506 282-2340 
- Contract Administration: Claire Lavoie (Contract Administration)
